result.markdown:
--- title: "Building Claims Rules" format: html: reference-location: block editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ::: {.cell} ::: # Goal To build a composable, portable, and extensible healthcare claims rules engine. The engine will be used to evaluate claims data for compliance with a set of rules. The rules will be defined in a structured format and will be evaluated using R code, but should be general enough to be easily translated to another language. The goal is to create a flexible and extensible system that can be used to evaluate claims data in a variety of scenarios, pre- or post. ## Similar Work - [queryBuilder](https://github.com/r-world-devs/queryBuilder) - [healthdb](https://github.com/KevinHzq/healthdb) # Anatomy of a **Rule** ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} `````{=html} 
          Field                        Description
1        @index                 Unique Rule Number
2   @identifier     Unique Alphanumeric Identifier
3     @category          High-Level Classification
4   @definition         Human Readable Description
5    @rationale          Reason for Implementation
6       @source URLs, References, or Documentation
7        @steps      A <list> of Steps to Evaluate
````` ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: # Anatomy of a **Step** ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} `````{=html} 
         Field                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Description
1        @type Qualifier: All but the last step in the rule. Identify claims that meet the criteria for inspection. Claim is skipped if not met.
    Terminator: Final step, the result of which indicates a pass or fail. Claim is skipped if it passes. If it fails, the full claim information should be returned, along with the rationale for the failure.
2       @order                                                                          Certain steps must be ahead of others, for instance:
     Dates should always be first
     @dos should always be first if present, unless patient @age is required
     If @age is required, it should be first and calculated as the number of days from @dob to @dos
3    @variable                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Element to evaluate
4       @value                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Valid value, @variable's expected state
5   @operation                                                                                                                  Validation Method:
    Regex: grepl('^I10', icd) | grepl('^J[0-9]{5}', hcpcs)
    Calculation: as.integer(dos - dob)
    Comparison: x > y, x < y, x >= y, x <= y
    Equality: x == y, identical(x, y)
    Presence: !is.na(x)
6   @condition                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Functional R code to call based on @operation selected
7     @message                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Message to report if final @terminator step is not met
````` ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: # Anatomy of a **Variable** - **`payer` ** - `level`: Primary, Secondary, Tertiary - `group`: Self-Pay, Commercial, Medicare, Medicaid, etc. - `name`: BCBS, Medicaid, etc. - `state`: State Abbreviation *(optional)* - **`provider`** - `npi`: National Provider Identifier - `taxonomy`: Taxonomy Code - `credential`: MD, DO, etc. - `role`: Rendering, Referring, Supervising, Ordering - **`procedure`** - `hcpcs`: HCPCS Code: `^[A-CEGHJ-MP-V0-9][0-9]{3,3}[AFMTU0-9]$` - `mod_1`: Modifier 1: `^[A-HJ-NP-VXZ1-9][0-9A-Z]$` - `mod_2`: Modifier 2 - `mod_3`: Modifier 3 - `mod_4`: Modifier 4 - `unit`: HCPCS Units of Service - `ndc`: National Drug Code - `rev_code`: Revenue Code - **`pos`**: Place of Service - `code`: 02, 11, etc. `^[0-9]{2}$` - `type`: **Facility** or **Non-Facility** - `description`: Hospital, Clinic, etc. - `claim`: - **Institutional**: Facility - `(ub04|1450|cms-1450)` - **Professional**: Non-Facility - `(hcfa|1500|cms-1500)` - **`patient`**: - `dos`: Date of Service - `dob`: Date of Birth - `age` - `sex` - `icd`: ICD-10-CM Code # S7 ::: {.panel-tabset} ## Step ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} step <- S7::new_class( name = "step", package = "crules", properties = list( order = S7::class_integer, variable = S7::class_character, value = S7::new_property(class = S7::class_any) ), validator = function(self) { if (length(self@order) != 1) return("@order must be length 1") if (length(self@variable) != 1) return("@variable must be length 1") }) step(order = 1L, variable = "dos", value = "2024-08-04") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ order : int 1 @ variable: chr "dos" @ value : chr "2024-08-04" ``` ::: ::: ## Rule ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} rule <- S7::new_class( name = "rule", package = "crules", properties = list( index = S7::class_numeric, identifier = S7::class_character, category = S7::class_character, definition = S7::class_character, rationale = S7::class_character, alert = S7::class_character, timestamp = S7::new_property( class = S7::class_Date, getter = function(self) clock::date_now(zone = "")), steps = S7::class_list ) ) rule ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` class @ parent : @ constructor: function(index, identifier, category, definition, rationale, alert, steps) {...} @ validator : @ properties : $ index : or $ identifier: $ category : $ definition: $ rationale : $ alert : $ timestamp : S3 $ steps : ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rule( index = 1L, identifier = "HCPCS:EXP:001", category = "Invalid HCPCS", definition = " is after [2019-01-01] AND is [43760]", rationale = "Effective 2019-01-01, HCPCS 43760 is invalid", alert = "See HCPCS [43762, 43763]") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ index : int 1 @ identifier: chr "HCPCS:EXP:001" @ category : chr "Invalid HCPCS" @ definition: chr " is after [2019-01-01] AND is [43760]" @ rationale : chr "Effective 2019-01-01, HCPCS 43760 is invalid" @ alert : chr "See HCPCS [43762, 43763]" @ timestamp : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2024-11-12 12:24:31" @ steps : list() ``` ::: ::: ## Variable ### Patient ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} patient <- S7::new_class( name = "patient", package = "crules", properties = list( sex = S7::class_character, dos = S7::new_property( class = S7::class_Date, default = Sys.Date(), setter = function(self, value) { self@dos <- as.Date(value) self }), dob = S7::new_property( class = S7::class_Date, setter = function(self, value) { self@dob <- as.Date(value) self }), age = S7::new_property( class = S7::class_integer, getter = function(self) { as.integer(self@dos - self@dob) }) ), validator = function(self) { if (length(self@sex) != 1) return("@sex must be length 1") if (!self@sex %in% c("Male", "Female", "Other")) return("@sex must be Male, Female, or Other") if (length(self@dos) != 1) return("@dos must be length 1") if (length(self@dob) != 1) return("@dob must be length 1") if (length(self@age) != 1) return("@age must be length 1") if (self@dob >= self@dos) return("@dob must be before @dos") if (self@age <= 0) return("@age must be greater than 0 days") } ) patient ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` class @ parent : @ constructor: function(sex, dos, dob) {...} @ validator : function(self) {...} @ properties : $ sex: $ dos: S3 $ dob: S3 $ age: ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} patient(dob = "2024-08-03", dos = "2024-08-04", sex = "Male") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ sex: chr "Male" @ dos: Date[1:1], format: "2024-08-04" @ dob: Date[1:1], format: "2024-08-03" @ age: int 1 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} pt_one <- patient( dob = "2024-08-03", dos = "2024-08-04", sex = "Male") pt_one@dob <- "2021-07-31" pt_one ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ sex: chr "Male" @ dos: Date[1:1], format: "2024-08-04" @ dob: Date[1:1], format: "2021-07-31" @ age: int 1100 ``` ::: ::: ### Payer ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} payer <- S7::new_class( name = "payer", package = "crules", properties = list( name = S7::class_character, state = S7::class_character, level = S7::class_character, group = S7::new_property( class = S7::class_character, getter = function(self) { dplyr::case_match( self@name, "BCBS" ~ "Commercial", "Medicaid" ~ "Medicaid", "Medicare" ~ "Medicare", "Patient" ~ "Self-Pay", .default = "Other") }) ), validator = function(self) { if (length(self@name) != 1) return("@name must be length 1") if (length(self@level) != 1) return("@level must be length 1") } ) payer(name = "BCBS", level = "Primary", state = "TX") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ name : chr "BCBS" @ state: chr "TX" @ level: chr "Primary" @ group: chr "Commercial" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} bcbcs_tx <- payer( name = "BCBS", level = "Primary", state = "TX") bcbcs_tx ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ name : chr "BCBS" @ state: chr "TX" @ level: chr "Primary" @ group: chr "Commercial" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} bcbcs_tx@name <- "Medicaid" bcbcs_tx ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ name : chr "Medicaid" @ state: chr "TX" @ level: chr "Primary" @ group: chr "Medicaid" ``` ::: ::: ### Encounter ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} encounter <- S7::new_class( name = "encounter", package = "crules", properties = list( pos = S7::class_character, referring = S7::class_character, rendering = S7::class_character, patient = S7::new_property(class = patient), payer = S7::new_property(class = payer) ) ) enc <- encounter( pos = "11", referring = "1234567890", rendering = "0987654321", patient( dob = "2020-08-04", dos = "2024-08-04", sex = "Male" ), payer( name = "BCBS", level = "Primary", state = "TX")) enc@patient@dob <- "2023-07-31" enc ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @ pos : chr "11" @ referring: chr "1234567890" @ rendering: chr "0987654321" @ patient : .. @ sex: chr "Male" .. @ dos: Date[1:1], format: "2024-08-04" .. @ dob: Date[1:1], format: "2023-07-31" .. @ age: int 370 @ payer : .. @ name : chr "BCBS" .. @ state: chr "TX" .. @ level: chr "Primary" .. @ group: chr "Commercial" ``` ::: ::: ::: # Validation ::: {.panel-tabset} ## DOS ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} qualify_dos <- \(df, dos, date) { arg <- rlang::caller_arg(dos) call <- rlang::caller_env() x <- vctrs::vec_slice(df, df[[dos]] > date) if (vctrs::vec_is_empty(x)) { cli::cli_inform( "0 matches for {.strong {.val {rlang::sym(dos)}}} > {.val {as.Date(date)}}", arg = arg, call = call, class = "qualify_dos" ) } x } rule_001_example <- dplyr::tibble( dos = as.Date(c("2024-01-01", "2018-01-01")), hcpcs = as.character(c(43760, 99213)) ) rule_001_example ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:----------|:-----| |2024-01-01 |43760 | |2018-01-01 |99213 | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rule_001_example2 <- dplyr::tibble( dos = as.Date(c("2017-01-01", "2018-01-01", "2019-01-01")), hcpcs = as.character(c(99213, 99213, 99213)) ) rule_001_example2 ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:----------|:-----| |2017-01-01 |99213 | |2018-01-01 |99213 | |2019-01-01 |99213 | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rule_001_example |> qualify_dos("dos", "2019-01-01") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:----------|:-----| |2024-01-01 |43760 | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rule_001_example2 |> qualify_dos("dos", "2019-01-01") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` 0 matches for dos > 2019-01-01 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:---|:-----| ::: ::: ## HCPCS ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} term_hcpcs <- \(df, hcpcs, code) { arg <- rlang::caller_arg(hcpcs) call <- rlang::caller_env() x <- vctrs::vec_slice(df, df[[hcpcs]] == code) if (vctrs::vec_is_empty(x)) { cli::cli_inform( "0 matches for {.strong {.val {rlang::sym(hcpcs)}}} == {.val {rlang::sym(code)}}", arg = arg, call = call, class = "term_hcpcs" ) } x } rule_001_example |> term_hcpcs("hcpcs", "43760") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:----------|:-----| |2024-01-01 |43760 | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rule_001_example2 |> term_hcpcs("hcpcs", "43760") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` 0 matches for hcpcs == 43760 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:---|:-----| ::: ::: ## Both ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} #| label: both #| echo: true #| eval: true #| message: true #| warning: true #| error: true rule_001_example |> qualify_dos("dos", "2019-01-01") |> term_hcpcs("hcpcs", "43760") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:----------|:-----| |2024-01-01 |43760 | ::: ```{.r .cell-code} rule_001_example2 |> qualify_dos("dos", "2019-01-01") |> term_hcpcs("hcpcs", "43760") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` 0 matches for dos > 2019-01-01 0 matches for hcpcs == 43760 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} |dos |hcpcs | |:---|:-----| ::: ::: ## Stored ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} dos <- Sys.Date() condition <- cleaned_steps |> select(condition) |> slice(2) |> pull(condition) condition ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` dos > "2019-01-01" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} condition |> rlang::parse_expr() |> rlang::eval_bare() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: ::: # Raw Definitions ::: {.panel-tabset} ## 1 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} print_desc(1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @hcpcs is [43760] %AND% @dos after [01/01/2019] ``` ::: ::: ## 50 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} print_desc(50) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @hcpcs is [G0468] %AND% @hcpcs is not [G0402, G0438, G0439] ``` ::: ::: ## 100 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} print_desc(100) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @icd is [R63.5] %AND% @icd is one of [O26.0*, E66.*] ``` ::: ::: ## 500 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} print_desc(500) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @hcpcs is one of [0214T, 0215T, 0217T, 0218T, 0219T, 0220T, 0221T, 0222T, 0263T, 0265T, 0266T, 0269T, 0274T, 0275T, 0329T, 0330T, 0422T, 0444T, 0445T, 0506T, 0507T, 15777, 20939, 22510, 22511, 22512, 22513, 22514, 22515, 22526, 22527, 27197, 27198, 30801, 30802, 31231, 32673, 34713, 34714, 34715, 34716, 34717, 36221, 34812, 34820, 34833, 34834, 35572, 50300, 50540, 54420, 54430, 55200, 55250, 55300, 58575, 58600, 58605, 58700, 58720, 58800, 58805, 58900, 58920, 58925, 58940, 58943, 61000, 61001, 61253, 63035, 63043, 63044, 63045, 63046, 63047, 63048, 64421, 64480, 64484, 64491, 64492, 64494, 64495, 64634, 64636, 76514, 92025, 92081, 92082, 92083, 92132, 92133, 92134, 92145, 92201, 92202, 92227, 92228, 92229, 92235, 92240, 92242, 95870, C7501, C7502, C7504, C7505, C9771, E0675, G0279, G0412, G0413, G0414, G0415, S2342] %AND% <<@mod_1 is [50, RT, LT] %OR% @mod_2 is [50, RT, LT]>> ``` ::: ::: ## 1000 ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} print_desc(1000) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` @primary_class is [MEDICAID] %AND% @age is less than [21 YRS] %AND% @hcpcs is one of [9938*, 9939*] ``` ::: ::: ::: # Metadata * Rulesets * Identifiers: 712 * Categories: 621 * Definitions: 703 * Rationales: 659 * Sources: 2 - [X] `index`: Row number - [X] `number`: Rule Number - [X] `identifier`: Split letters/numbers, categorize Payer, State, etc. - [ ] `category`: Categories make little sense, need to be reclassified - [ ] `definition`: Define Variables, Logic, Remove Parentheses - [ ] `rationale`: Steps are detailed in the rationale that are missing from the rule set - [X] `source`: *Optional*; Extract urls from `category` Need to define `instruction`/`suggestion` variable, taken from `rationale` ## Descriptors ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
number identifier category
705 ICD:CM
Z34 Encounter for supervision of normal pregnancy
Encounter for supervision of normal pregnancy (Z34) should not be reported with any complication of pregnancy (O00-O9A), encounter for pregnancy test (Z32.0-), or encounter for supervision of high risk pregnancy (O09.-).
403 VAX
90697 Component billing
90697 (DTaP-IPVHib-HepB) has 6 components. Code each component of a combination vaccine individually.
724 OBGYN
NA
Review Anthem BCBS Payer Guidelines. Medical problems complicating labor and delivery management may require additional resources and should be identified by utilizing the appropriate CPT codes in the Medicine and Evaluation and Management Services section of the CPT manual in addition to codes for maternity care.
233 ORTHO
29916, 29915
29915 should not be reported with 29916 - acetabuloplasty is included in the global service description of 29916 when performed on the same hip.
955 MEDSV
Highmark BCBS
Moderate to High Complexity E/M codes 99214/99215 are not allowed on same day as 97161-97172 when performed by the same provider.
831 ICD:CM
Coding guidelines
Z20.822 should not be billed with current Covid-19 infection U07.1
1019 FQHC
NA
Only 1 New patient visit is allowed. Use G0466 to bill for the medical visit and G0470 to bill for the mental health visit.
129 ICD:CM
F30 Excludes1
Manic Episode (F30) and bipolar disorder (F31.-), major depressive disorder, recurrent (F33.-), and/or major depressive disorder, single episode (F32.-) identify conditions that cannot be reported together except when the two conditions are unrelated per the ICD-10-CM Excludes1 note guideline.
1054 MCD:AL
NA
Add EPSDT info for all preventative visits for patients under 21 years old. The EPSDT Indicator will allow care to be renderedand bypass the visit limits per year.
991 E&M
NA
99339/99340 are expired codes. See CPT 99437, 99491, 99424, 99425.
``` ::: ::: ## Definitions ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
definition

1041 @primary_name is one of [CIGNA, CIGNA CONNECTICUT GENERAL, CIGNA - GREAT WEST, CIGNA MEDICARE ACCESS, CIGNA INTERNATIONAL, CIGNA GWH, CIGNA VOLUNTARY, CIGNA PPO, CIGNA] %AND% @dos after [05/25/2023] %AND% @hcpcs is one of [99212, 99213, 99214, 99215] %AND% <<@mod_1 is [25] %OR% @mod_2 is [25]>>
472 @primary_class is [MEDICAID, MEDICAID CMO] %AND% @pos is one of [02, 10] %AND% @hcpcs is one of [9920*, 9921*, 99251, 99252, 99253, 99254, 99255, 90832, 90833, 90834, 90835, 90836, 90837, 90838, 90791, 90792, 96116, 93010, 93307, 93308, 93320, 93321, 93325] %AND% @mod_1 is not [GT]

``` ::: ::: ## Step Components Two types of a step: `qualifier` and `terminator` A **qualifier** is basically a long `if (x & y & (a | b | c))` statement. A **terminator** is the final step, analogous to a `stopifnot()` statement that checks the data. - [X] `number`: - [X] `order`: - [X] `identifier`: - [X] `variable`: Recode to standardize names - [X] `class`: Variable Data Class - [X] `group`: Variable Grouping - [X] `action`: Translate to `condition` - [X] `value`: Coerce to correct data type, deal with wildcards - [X] `condition`: Predicate function that evaluates to `TRUE` or `FALSE` ### Variables - [X] `dos`: 81 - [X] `pos`: 142 - [X] `ub04`: 106 - [X] `age`: 158 - [X] `sex`: 3 - [X] `referring`: 14 - [X] `rendering`: 20 - [X] `icd`:
